definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
Bren gun, British light machine gun first produced in 1937

sentences.english: We fought with them with grenade and sub-machine gun in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 在叢林中，我們用手榴彈和輕機槍掙扎着。

sentences.english: In battle, light machine guns are soldiers' main weapon.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥中，輕機槍是士兵們主要的作戰武器。

sentences.english: Just two light machine-guns for the whole company.
sentences.chinese: 整個連只有二挺輕機槍。

sentences.english: The rest were in trenches with light MG and SMGs.
sentences.chinese: 其餘的人都在戰壕裏用輕機槍和衝鋒槍射擊。

sentences.english: You'd be lucky to shoot a fighter down with a light machine-gun.
sentences.chinese: 你很幸運能用輕機槍打下一架戰鬥機。

sentences.english: We even received a DP (Degtyarev) light machine-gun and a couple of drum magazines for it.
sentences.chinese: 我們得到了一挺捷格加廖夫輕機槍和幾個彈盤。

sentences.english: DP was a light machine-gun. We had a lot of them, in every platoon.
sentences.chinese: 捷格加廖夫是輕機槍，我們有很多，每個排都有。

sentences.english: Almost invariably, BAR men are exemplary in their conservation of ammunition.
sentences.chinese: 勃朗寧輕機槍手通常是節約彈藥的模範。

sentences.english: Could You Please Oblige Us With A Bren Gun?
sentences.chinese: 請把布朗式輕機槍給我們，好嗎？
